avalancheActivity.comment:
The more recent wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2000 m. On steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain small and medium-sized slab avalanches are possible.
Several small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days represent the main danger. The weather will be mild.

snowpackStructure.comment: The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften during the day. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. In particular at low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: The older wind slabs are easy to recognise and unlikely to be released now.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: The surface of the snowpack will soften during the day. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. Hardly any snow is lying above approximately 1600 m.
